TMDA Commercial Support

TMDA has a free support infastructure including documentation, public mailing lists, and searchable mailing list archives. These services are supported by the spare time of other TMDA users.

If these resources aren't able to satisfy your needs, and you are willing to pay for additional help, third-party commercial support is available from the list of vendors below.
  • Stand Blue Technology provides service and support for TMDA, Postfix, qmail, djbdns, qmail-scanner, Clam Antivirus, vpopmail, ezmlm, and SpamAssassin from Richmond, Virginia.

  • Summersault provides professional consulting services for organizations wanting to upgrade, secure, fix or replace their e-mail infrastructure. We have expert experience with qmail-related spam prevention/reduction strategies, including TMDA.

  • Drew Raines provides low cost, enterprise-level support for qmail and TMDA, as well as IMAP/POP/web-mail integration.

  • Symetrix Consulting supports companies and organizations that wish to use opensource software to reduce operating expenses and increase productivity. Current support includes Anti-SPAM provisions (sendmail RBLs, milters, and TMDA integration), RedHat Linux, OpenOffice.org office suite, mySQL database, integration with current commercial infrastructures, network, and firewall support. Support contracts are available. Accepts purchase orders, personal and company checks, and Paypal for credit cards.

  • Mike Meyer commercially supports TMDA, qmail, and many other software packages. Remote admin work, as well as e-mail and phone support is available. He accepts purchase orders.

  • Dungog Networks builds rpms for the Mitel SME Linux distribution that make configuring and using other packages such as TMDA a trivial task. Payment via online credit card.

  • Advantive Associates

  • Lloyd Zusman
If you'd like to be listed on this page, please let me know.
